snippet: A draft document prepared for Cyprus’s international lenders set the total cost at 23 billion euros, or about $30 billion, rather than 17 billion euros, and said Cyprus would pay the difference.
abstract: Grim assessment released by Cyprus's international lenders predicts that country will fall into downward economic spiral for at least two years, as its economy contracts up to 12.5 percent; Cyprus will have to quickly raise at least 13 billion euros to keep deficit from spinning out of control and to meet terms of new bailout deal.
lead_paragraph: A draft document prepared for Cyprus’s international lenders set the total cost at 23 billion euros, or about $30 billion, rather than 17 billion euros, and said Cyprus would pay the difference.

headline.seo: Cyprus Bailout to Cost More Than Predicted, Creditors Say
headline.main: Future Looks Bleaker Than Anticipated in Cyprus, Its Creditors Claim
headline.print_headline: Future Looks Bleaker Than Anticipated in Cyprus, Its Creditors Claim
